intro: Stevia sarensis var. typica, commonly known as the sweetleaf plant, is a perennial shrub native to Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped, serrated leaves that contain high concentrations of steviol glycosides, natural sweeteners. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Its leaves are harvested and processed to extract the sweet compounds used in food and beverages. Stevia sarensis var. typica is valued for its intense sweetness and is often used as a natural alternative to sugar.
